text: Now this is a free living organism, but you get the idea This is one cell It has no brain, no nervous system It is highly competent at its own tiny little cell level agendas And you can ask the question of whether you can reward and punish this And I think most people will say you can, and in fact, of course you can do experiments where you provide positive advantage, negative reinforcement and, and so on But then you have to remind, remind yourself that this thing here, so here's another, here's another unicellular organism This is kind of a sad video What you're watching is, is the death of a minimal, minimal being
content_summary: The speaker discusses the behavior and competence of unicellular organisms, highlighting their ability to respond to positive and negative reinforcements. The speaker also presents a video showing the death of a minimal being, which is another unicellular organism.
